result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L Rowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: NOTE: If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the conditions of probation.
Consecutive to: ** AMENDED ON 10/24/2022 TO REFLECT PROBATION IN THIS FILE IS CONSECUTIVE TO JAIL SENTENCE IN FILE 21CF461.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. Court costs are paid in full.
----------------------

Possess no firearms, facsimile firearms, ammunition, or other dangerous weapons.
----------------------

No alcohol. Not to enter any bars or liquor stores. No contact with anyone selling, using, or possessing a controlled substance. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medications without a valid prescription. 
----------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

BOND TO COVER 22GF891, 22CF386, 22CF33, 21CM599, & 21CF461

DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES IF RELEASED. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia or controlled substances.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH RESIDENCE @ 318 N. 8TH STREET DELAVAN, WI. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ERATUS GREEN. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Steven L Rowe in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF33 - and status on 21CF461. Complaint on new filed was filed 10 minutes ago by the State. Atty. Herrmann provides copies of complaint. Atty. Walter goes over charges and penalties and asks for preliminary hearing, and waives time limits. 
Court addresses request of Atty. Walter to release 1/2 of the bond money posted to him as payment for attorney fees. State has no objection. Court grants the request and releases 1/2 of the posted bond money from 21CF461 to Attorney Walter. Matter set for preliminary hearing with pending file - 21CF461 to track.  Court in recess.
